title: Oh look, another game lost because we have no front line
body: But somehow tanks are unviable *wink face*

A strong frontline is important if you plan on standing your ground or playing aggressive.  Kite comps can be good but unless you have some huge speed boost (like a Sivir ult) then you won't really be securing any objectives or winning many fights without a turret behind you.  A strong frontline will just chase you away while their backline takes the objective, and then they turn around and run once the objective is gone.
That's not true. Mages like lissandra/kennen/rumble are as good or better at straight up teamfighting than tanks. Pro teams that take a lissandra/kennen/rumble top aren't doing it for the poke.

>tanks are unviable

blitz and leona are top tier picks

Nah it's not that tanks aren't viable, it's that tank itemization is inefficient, especially when you consider the fact that carries have LW / Void Staff to shred through all of the gold you put into your build.

Bruisers can use most of the same tanky items and have damage to go along with it, so full tanks aren't the best option unless we get some item buffs aimed at helping tanks actually TANK things.

Full carries teams must play on numbers and fast focusing of the most trathening enemies. Something that can't be done with a lot of coordination/teamplay.

Team with 1-2 tanks have to stick together in order to give their tanks windows for being the disruptors of the enemies.


I like tanking really much (even if my mains aren't pure tanks) but I usually find myself with team mates hard chasing enemies, fake engaging or just diving into enemies expecting my Taric to have the same mobility of our Assas.
They aren't unviable, they're just not very rewarding to play unless you're with a team you trust. Kind of like supports!

Pros don't use tanks because their knowledge and coordination of this game is high enough so they can circumvent the need for a front line.

For us lowly Bronzes, Silvers, and Golds, your best bet is still most likely going to be having a front line as its the easiest way to protect the carry as oppose to trying to coordinate between three players a massive burst down of one person to make it a 5v4 right from the start which is what most team comp without tanks tend to be oriented towards. If you noticed, with those comps, if they can't burst down one person right at the beginning of the fight, they usually end up losing the fight.

True. I'm trying to suggest a way to evaluate them, though.
